title: cat or car?
description: this personal project was meant to apply my small bit of knowledge in machine learning in preperation for my [cs559 course](https://web.stevens.edu/catalog/archive/2023-2024/en/catalog/academic-catalog/courses/cs-computer-science/500/cs-559.html). it uses a tensorflow.js model to predict whether an image is a cat or a car.

title: a survey of rov++: we may need another napkin
description: did a little research with the [insure+e program](https://www.caecommunity.org/initiatives/initiative-insure) to create a poster/paper on the security of border gateway protocol, rov++ and rpki infrastructure.

title: portfolio website
description: youre literally looking at it...but...i made this website with nextjs in order to hone my web development skills and to have a place to put all my projects. i also have some blogs about it!

title: osu-beatmap-generator
description: this personal project is a collaboration with [Dhruv Prasanna](https://github.com/21dhruvp) as we go through a machine learning project related to a video game we both enjoy. the goal is to take any song and generate an osu beatmap with manually inputted difficulty stats.

title: brew review
description: this was a cs554 final project. we used redis, firebase/fireauth and nextjs to make a basic website to review coffee shops.

title: goodminton
description: this was a cs546 final project. we used handlebars and an expressjs backend to create a static reservation and tournament site for our collegiate badminton club.

title: discord bot
description: this was a project made with discord.js. it was made for a twitch server that i ran! it has a moderation system, a levelling system, and some rank commands using the brawlhalla api.
